snippet: A government inquiry says criminal charges should be brought against the owner of the Tazreen Fashions factory, where a Nov. 24 fire killed 112 people.
abstract: Preliminary report by Bangladesh government inquiry says that criminal charges for 'unpardonable negligence' should be brought against Delowar Hossain, owner of Bangladesh garment factory Tazreen Fashions, where fire in November killed 112 people.

byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and JIM YARDLEY
byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Jim Yardley from New Delhi. Steven Greenhouse contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A government inquiry says criminal charges should be brought against the owner of the Tazreen Fashions factory, where a Nov. 24 fire killed 112 people.

headline.seo: Bangladesh Finds Gross Negligence in Factory Fire
headline.main: Bangladesh Finds Gross Negligence in Factory Fire
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Finds Gross Negligence in Factory Fire
